etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 口(口) + 口(口) + 口(口) + phonetic: 呂(呂) (lǚ, "spine") = mouths indicating multiple compartments + spine indicating strength -> tool or device
etymology.interpretation: The character 器(qì) combines four instances of 口(kǒu, "mouth") to suggest multiple openings or compartments, symbolizing a tool or device. The addition of 呂(lǚ, "spine") adds a phonetic element and conveys strength or structural integrity, reinforcing the idea of something solidly constructed and multifaceted like a tool or implement.

examples.chinese: 这个器很精致(這個器很精緻)。
古人制作器时注重工艺(古人製作器時注重工藝)，传承千古智慧(傳承千古智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén zhìzuò qì shí zhùzhòng gōngyì, chuánchéng qiān gǔ zhìhuì.
examples.english: Ancient people paid attention to craftsmanship when making tools, inheriting timeless wisdom.

examples.chinese: 他借用精良的器修复了古董(他借用精良的器修復了古董)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jièyòng jīngliáng de qì xiūfùle gǔdǒng.
examples.english: He borrowed a fine tool to restore the antique.
